om.tnavigator.db
Class DatabaseAccess

java.lang.Object
  om.tnavigator.db.DatabaseAccess

public class DatabaseAccess
extends java.lang.Object

Thread-safe database access code

Nested Class Summary
 class DatabaseAccess.Transaction
          A single SQL transaction that can contain multiple queries and updates.

Constructor Detail

DatabaseAccess

public DatabaseAccess(java.lang.String sURL,
                      Log l)
Constructs access pool. Note that this starts a cleanup thread so you must take care to always call close().

Parameters:
sURL - JDBC URL of database including password etc.
l - Log to use for debug and error logging (null if none required)
Method Detail

close

public void close()
Closes access pool along with all database connections.

setMaxConnections

public void setMaxConnections(int iMaxConnections)
Sets the number of JDBC connections to open (at maximum). Default is 5.

Parameters:
iMaxConnections - Max. number of connections

newTransaction

public DatabaseAccess.Transaction newTransaction()
                                          throws java.sql.SQLException
Creates a new DatabaseAccess.Transaction. You must call finish() on this - immediately after this call returns, a try/finally block should begin that calls finish() on the Transaction.

This call may block if no connection is available.

Returns:
Transaction object to do stuff with
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - If there's a problem creating a required database connection

newUnpooledConnection

public java.sql.Connection newUnpooledConnection()
                                          throws java.sql.SQLException
Obtains a new connection separate from the general pool. You must close this connection when done with it (use try/finally).

Returns:
New connection object
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - If there's a problem creating the connection

getConnectionCount

public int getConnectionCount()
Returns:
Number of connections currently up
